com.ctrlaltelite.pos.gui

Class ManageInventoryController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ctrlaltelite.pos.gui.ManageInventoryController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class ManageInventoryController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Controller class for managing inventory items held on the database. Allows for adding and editing inventory items, and produces Restock Reports and Product Usage Charts for analytics on inventory usage.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      ManageInventoryController()

      int getNumFromStringHead(java.lang.String s)
      A function that gets numbers from the head of a string; gets numeric values until a non-numeric value is hit, then returns the gathered value

      Initializes the style sheets for the page, and calls the function to set up all button functionality in javafx
      static boolean isNum(java.lang.String string)
      A function to determine if a string value is a number
      void itemButtonClick(javafx.scene.control.Button clickedButton)
      Function called when a button for an inventory item is clicked; causes appropriate item info to be displayed on screen
      void refreshUI()
      A function designed to reset the values in various text fields on the screen, as well as refresh lists of inventory items, to keep the GUI accurate
      void restockReportClick()
      A function called to generate the Restock Report, using data from the database regarding current and recommended stock
      void setUpButtons()
      sets up the buttons on the GUI to perform their intended action; also handles errors from those functions
      void usedItemsInTimePeriod()
      The function that generates the Product Usage Chart, using a given time span and sales data in that range
      void valueButtonClick(com.ctrlaltelite.pos.gui.ManageInventoryController.changeType ct)
      An unused function that handles exclusively adding and removing quantity for an inventory item
